node.title: Victorian COVID hospitalisations at 873 as state records eight further deaths
node.alt: A parent and their two children, all three wearing cloth face masks, on a Melbourne street.
node.description: Victoria records another 10,053 cases of COVID-19, a number which is expected to rise when more than 1 million students return to face-to-face school learning from today.
node.content:
["Victoria has recorded eight further COVID-related deaths, as the number of people in hospital after contracting the virus\u00a0has\u00a0fallen to 873.", "The number of people in hospital is down from the 889 reported on Sunday, which was down from the 953 recorded on Saturday.", "Of those patients, 102 are in intensive care units, of whom 33 are on a ventilator.", "There were 10,053 new cases officially detected.", "That tally was split by 6,485 rapid antigen tests (RATs) and 3,568\u00a0PCR test results.", "It brings the total number of official active cases to 76,335, down from the 78,294 reported a day earlier.", "That number is expected to rise when more than 1 million students return to face-to-face school learning from today.", "", "
More than 1 million students are enrolled in Victorian schools and most are returning to classrooms today.(ABC News: Danielle Bonica)
", "The government's return-to-school plan centres around RATs, face masks, mandatory booster shots for teachers, and ventilation in the classroom.", "", "
Rosewood Downs Primary School students Maya, Pippa and Ethan showing their negative rapid antigen test results.(ABC News: Dana Morse)
", "Less than half of the five-to-11-year-old\u00a0cohort has received a first dose of a paediatric COVID-19 vaccine, after becoming eligible on January 10.", "About 38 per cent of adult Victorians have received three doses of a vaccine.", "More to come.", "", "
I've had COVID, can I get it again?
"]
